description: From Latin citrus (“citron tree, thuja”), probably via Etruscan from Ancient Greek κέδρος (kédros); compare Middle English citurtre, cytyr tre.

adjectives.description: citrus (not generally comparable, comparative more citrus, superlative most citrus)

entries.meaning: Of, relating to, or similar to citrus plants or fruit.

nouns.description: citrus (plural citruses or (rare) citrusses or (rare) citri)

entries.meaning: Any of several shrubs or trees of the genus Citrus in the family Rutaceae.

The fruit of such plants, generally spherical, oblate, or prolate, consisting of an outer glandular skin (called zest), an inner white skin (called pith or albedo), and generally between 8 and 16 sectors filled with pulp consisting of cells with one end attached to the inner skin. Citrus fruits include orange, grapefruit, lemon, lime, and citron.
